content:
Namaste! Congratulations on starting your yoga journey at Zen Den! Fueling your body with nutrient-dense foods is essential to support your practice and overall well-being. Smoothies are an excellent way to get a boost of energy and nourishment, especially post-yoga. Here are some healthy smoothie recipes that can help support your yoga practice:

**1. Berry Bliss**

* 1 cup frozen mixed berries (antioxidants and anti-inflammatory properties)
* 1/2 banana (potassium for muscle recovery)
* 1/2 cup plain Greek yogurt (protein for muscle repair)
* 1 tablespoon chia seeds (omega-3s for inflammation reduction)
* 1 teaspoon honey (natural energy booster)
* Ice cubes (as needed)

**2. Green Goddess**

* 2 cups spinach (iron for energy and oxygenation)
* 1/2 cup frozen pineapple (anti-inflammatory properties)
* 1/2 cup coconut water (electrolytes for hydration)
* 1 scoop protein powder (supports muscle recovery)
* 1 tablespoon chia seeds (omega-3s for inflammation reduction)
* Ice cubes (as needed)

**3. Mango Madness**

* 1 cup frozen mango (vitamin C for immune system support)
* 1/2 cup plain Greek yogurt (protein for muscle repair)
* 1/2 cup coconut milk (healthy fats for energy)
* 1 tablespoon honey (natural energy booster)
* 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder (anti-inflammatory properties)
* Ice cubes (as needed)

**4. Banana Boost**

* 1 ripe banana (potassium for muscle recovery)
* 1/2 cup frozen berries (antioxidants and anti-inflammatory properties)
* 1/2 cup almond milk (healthy fats for energy)
* 1 scoop protein powder (supports muscle recovery)
* 1 tablespoon almond butter (healthy fats for energy)
* Ice cubes (as needed)

**5. Golden Turmeric**

* 1/2 cup frozen pineapple (anti-inflammatory properties)
* 1/2 cup coconut milk (healthy fats for energy)
* 1/2 cup plain Greek yogurt (protein for muscle repair)
* 1 teaspoon turmeric powder (anti-inflammatory properties)
* 1/2 teaspoon ginger powder (digestive aid)
* Ice cubes (as needed)

Tips:

* Use frozen fruits to make your smoothies colder and thicker.
* Experiment with different types of milk or yogurt to find your favorite.
* Add a scoop of protein powder or nuts/seeds to support muscle recovery and satisfaction.
* Incorporate healthy fats like coconut oil, almond butter, or chia seeds for sustained energy.
* Play around with spices like cinnamon, ginger, or turmeric to add flavor and anti-inflammatory benefits.

Enjoy your smoothies and happy practicing at Zen Den!
